Description: Fragment of papyrus written with black ink with demotic legal document dated year 24 of Ptolemy III Euergetes I (inferred from the name of the priest of Alexander in the surviving dating formula): part of 7 ll. on recto, part of 3 ll. on verso. Withdrawal after judgement by Sentaes daughter of Hakoris, concerning a lot of unbuilt land in Armant (Hermonthis). Restore Herieus the elder son of Harsiesis as scribe.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1990a / Catalogue of Demotic Papyri in the British Museum IV: Ptolemaic Legal Texts from the Theban Area (p.85, pl.71)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (8515) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/8515)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus Black ink Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: magic tape Binding: self adhesive tape Object Priority: A Mount Priority: C Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: fair (incomplete)
